title: Teens involved in apparent accidental shooting to face criminal charges
content:
SAN ANTONIO — Two teens involved in a fatal shooting Thursday morning are expected to face criminal charges, according to the San Antonio Police Department.
San Antonio Police Department spokesman Sgt. Javier Salazar said a 15-year-old suspected of fatally shooting Jose Estrada, 18, inside of a home in the 5400 block of War Cloud Drive around 12:15 a.m. is expected to face a charge of manslaughter.
Additionally, a 17-year-old who was also at the scene will face a charge of tampering with evidence.
Estrada had been hanging out inside a home with the 15-year-old and several of their friends prior to the shooting, according to police.
The 15-year-old was holding a gun that had been brought to the house by a friend when he fired one shot, striking Estrada in the chest.
He was pronounced dead at the scene.
After the shooting, the 15-year-old ran from the scene with the gun along with other who were present during the shooting.
